definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Carefully pull back the access line. The kink should be in the bottom of the burr hole.
sentences.chinese: 小心的往後拉入顱線，扭結應處於單孔的底端。

sentences.english: The lawyer refused to be drawn into such a shady case.
sentences.chinese: 這位律師拒絕被拉入這種不明不白的事情中去。

sentences.english: It'll offer two phones both featuring Blackberry's exclusive push-mail application.
sentences.chinese: 拉入的兩款烏莓腳機具有獨有的電兒郵件拉支法度。

sentences.english: I start to draw my bow into stern notch of ice-breaker.
sentences.chinese: 把我船頭拉入破冰船船尾凹部。

sentences.english: To pull in data from the server and cache it locally.
sentences.chinese: 從服務器拉入數據並緩存在本地。

sentences.english: Before implantation, the flexible double-disc patch is pulled into a catheter, collapsing and compressing it lengthwise.
sentences.chinese: 在植入前，可彎曲的雙片補片被拉入導管。

sentences.english: That will keep you away from the drag of the left side, and gradually then you can balance yourself also.
sentences.chinese: 那會避免你拉入左脈，然後你逐漸也可以平衡自己。

definition: to lead to/to draw to/to steer towards
to be drawn into/to be involved in
to lock one's door and refuse to see sb
to fall into/to dip below a certain level
to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
to return (an item)/to send back/to go back
to remove/to step back from involvement/to disengage
